info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 19 at 7:28AM CDT until April 19 at 1:30PM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Barry, McDonald and Newton.
* WHEN...Until 130 PM CDT Saturday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 728 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Bentonville Hollow at Highway E, Buffalo Creek at Klondike Road, Big Sugar Creek at Buzzard Glory Road, Mikes Creek at Highway U, Elkhorn Creek at Highway CC, Butler Creek at Kings Highway and Little Sugar Creek at Skaggs Hollow Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pineville, Anderson, Noel, Goodman, South West City, Lanagan, Dodge, Cayuga, Powell, Rocky Comfort, Tiff City, Ridgley and Big Sugar Creek State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: Barry, MO; McDonald, MO; Newton, MO
